channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ZOOKEEPER-378] contribution of Net::ZooKeeper Perl module
item.description:
As per the conversation in ZOOKEEPER-364, I submitted a Software Grant Agreement to the ASF last week for Net::ZooKeeper by fax and surface mail; it might take a few more days for it to show up in the private grants.txt file, I believe.

I also created a Net::ZooKeeper package, version 0.33, with licenses and a NOTICE file as required by the ASF for any ASF project. It is attached to this issue and also available at http://people.apache.org/~chrisd/projects/net_zookeeper/.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: really good to see this. ... it would be great to have in 3.2 release.

this looks great. it has tests/docs/licenses/readme.. I plan to check all the files into

src/contrib/zkperl

with all the files in zkperl as the top level directory (replacing Net-Zookeeper with zkperl).
So the dir structure would look like 

src/contrib/zkperl/Changes
src/contrib/zkperl/LICENSE
src/contrib/zkperl/MANIFEST
src/contrib/zkperl/Makefile.PL
src/contrib/zkperl/build
src/contrib/zkperl/t

comments?

Glad it looks OK. My only comment is that I'm fairly strongly attached to the Net::ZooKeeper name because it conforms to the well-established Perl module naming scheme and has been approved by the CPAN community. By all means check it into SVN under a "zkperl" directory or whatever you like; if you want to change the module name, though, we should have a conversation about that. But I think you're just talking about the directory name in SVN. Cheers.

I'm fine with zkperl, but how about something like "perl-client" or "zkperl-client"? as we add
more bindings I could see "perl-client, ruby-client, python-client, tcl-client" etc... zkruby/zkpython
is fine too, but having client in there is just a bit more descriptive of what the contrib does imo.

Also, does it matter that this is the perl binding on top of the C ZK client library, rather than
a straight perl based implementation? (not that I'm suggesting such a thing!) Perhaps this
is a "pro" wrt to having just one implementation and a general name...

Does this have a build.xml that can drive the tests from the toplevel build.xml? Before committing
also ensure it's included in the package, etc... (just the source, shouldn't actually build as part
of the toplevel "ant tar" target)

also we should run RAT tool on this.

I agree w/Chris and I think this is what Mahadev meant – that the contrib wil be
named contrib/zkperl (whatever) but the module name from perl perspective
"Net::ZooKeeper" will be unchanged (not tied to the contrib directory name)

@chris,

yes, I just meant the svn dir

also, we can just copy the build.xml from zkfuse in src/contrib/zkfuse/ and replace zkfuse with zkperl in the build.xml.

also, for the rat tool (i did just manually check for licences) we can just generate a patch with svn diff and then submit the patch.

lets go with zkperl directory for now.

src/contrib/zkperl/

Down the road a little, it would be nice to get the build.xml file to do a little more; e.g., build after the C client libs are built, and then run "ZK_TEST_HOSTS=localhost:22181 make test" after running "src/c/tests/zkServer.sh startClean". Probably worth a separate Jira issue, though.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12406390/ZOOKEEPER-378.patch
against trunk revision 768390.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no tests are needed for this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/Zookeeper-Patch-vesta.apache.org/49/console

This message is automatically generated.

the patch failed because of changes to CHANGES.txt. Chris, you do not have to submit chnages to CHANGES.txt (that is changed by committers when committing a patch). ill just remove the chnages to CHANGES.txt for now.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12406394/ZOOKEEPER-378.patch
against trunk revision 768390.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no tests are needed for this patch.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 159 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 154 warnings).

-1 core tests. The patch failed core unit tests.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/Zookeeper-Patch-vesta.apache.org/50/testReport/
Release audit warnings: http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/Zookeeper-Patch-vesta.apache.org/50/artifact/trunk/current/releaseAuditDiffWarnings.txt
Findbugs warnings: http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/Zookeeper-Patch-vesta.apache.org/50/artifact/trunk/build/test/findbugs/newPatchFindbugsWarnings.html
Console output: http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/Zookeeper-Patch-vesta.apache.org/50/console

This message is automatically generated.

The additional 5 release audit warnings are for files which don't need (or can't have) licenses, i.e., the Changes, README, NOTICE, MANIFEST, and LICENSE files. These are important for either running Makefile.PL, and/or releasing Net::ZooKeeper to CPAN.org periodically. (Perl users can be expected to look there for ZooKeeper support even before downloading a ZooKeeper package and looking there.)

FYI, the link in the Hudson report to the releaseAuditDiffWarnings.txt file is incorrect, it seems to be in .../artifact/trunk/patchprocess/. Also, it's not correct, but looking at the patchReleaseAuditWarnings.txt output reveals the extra five files.

As for the core test failure, I can't explain that one, since no tests are run out of the package. From the console output it looks like a C++ test dumped core? Weird, and purely coincidental as far as I can tell from here.

+1 to the patch ... the console output is cpp test failure which has nothign to do with the tests in the bindings.
we should fix the release audit link. I have never bothered to do fix it since you can get tot the page from top level page
http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/Zookeeper-Patch-vesta.apache.org/50/

Integrated in ZooKeeper-trunk #293 (See http://hudson.zones.apache.org/hudson/job/ZooKeeper-trunk/293/)
. perl binding for zookeeper (chris darroch via mahadev)
Thanks for the commit! I'll try to submit patch updates to keep in sync with any C API changes.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Net::ZooKeeper Perl module included under src/contribs/zkperl.
